main event: Multiple fishermen in Turkey observed two unidentified objects, one believed to be a guided missile and another a large, bright object falling from the sky, on December 13-14, 1957.
interesting points: On December 13, 1957, an object believed to be a guided missile was seen moving in a westerly direction toward the Crimea.
On December 14, 1957, a large, bright object was seen falling from the sky in the direction of the towns of Catagazzi and Kilimi.
Approximately fifteen seconds after the first object was seen falling, a second unidentified object was observed moving at great speed in a westerly direction, leaving a blue trace behind it.
The second unidentified object appeared to be moving about three inches above the horizon.

The report concludes that the characteristics, description, and other information indicate that the object was apparently a meteor, and the press and others later identified it as a brilliant object, probably a meteoroid encounter.
sighted object: guided missile and a large, bright object falling from the sky
